components.description:
Three, light blue droplets, as sweat beads, splashing down to the right. Resembles plewds, stylized sweat droplets used in comics and animation to show characters working hard or feeling stressed.

May be used to represent various types of liquids, including sexual fluids. May also be used to represent various liquid-based slang expressions (e.g., drip, “exceptional style, swagger").

Not to be confused with ðŸ’§ Droplet, though their applications may overlap.

Google, Microsoft, and Samsung's design previously featured two, upwardly directed droplets.
components.title: Splashing Sweat Symbol

description:
Three, light blue droplets, as sweat beads, splashing down to the right. Resembles plewds, stylized sweat droplets used in comics and animation to show characters working hard or feeling stressed.

May be used to represent various types of liquids, including sexual fluids. May also be used to represent various liquid-based slang expressions (e.g., drip, “exceptional style, swagger").

Not to be confused with ðŸ’§ Droplet, though their applications may overlap.

Google, Microsoft, and Samsung's design previously featured two, upwardly directed droplets.
title: Splashing Sweat Symbol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Comic style symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Beads of sweatÂ splashing in a single direction. Is not distinguishable from splashing water, and is often usedÂ as water instead of sweat. So http://emojipedia.org/splashing-sweat-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: sweat droplets

bn:00100892a: Being in a state between dry and wet; moderately wet; moist.
Of eyes: tearful, wet with tears.

bn:00107008a: Of weather, hot and wind-less and with high humidity, so that people feel sticky from sweating.
Persistent across multiple incarnations of a widget.

bn:00113818a: Of an object: covered with or impregnated with liquid.
Covered or soaked with a liquid such as water
Of an object, etc, covered with or impregnated with liquid.
Drenched with water, or other liquid.
Covered with or impregnated with liquid.

bn:00094141v: Cause (a liquid) to spatter about, especially with force
To hit or expel liquid at
To cause (a liquid) to spatter about, especially with force.

bn:00087325v: To fall one drop at a time.

bn:00094235v: Wet with a spurt of liquid

bn:00094593v: Take solid or liquid food into the mouth a little at a time either by drinking or by eating with a spoon
To sip; to take a small amount of food or drink into the mouth, especially with a spoon.

bn:13704224v: To come into contact with water or another liquid.

bn:00092122v: Expel or eject (saliva or phlegm or sputum) from the mouth
To evacuate saliva from the mouth.
To forcefully evacuate saliva from the mouth.
To evacuate (saliva or another substance) from the mouth.

bn:00094185v: Scatter in a mass or jet of droplets
To scatter in a mass or jet of droplets.

bn:00091564v: Excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin
To emit sweat or perspiration through the skin's pores.

bn:00085989v: Have a craving, appetite, or great desire for
To have a craving, appetite, or great desire for.

bn:00089548v: Become hydrated and combine with water

bn:00073468n: The act of scattering water about haphazardly

bn:00068949n: A clear liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands of the mouth; moistens the mouth and starts the digestion of starches

A clear, slightly alkaline liquid secreted into the mouth by the salivary glands and mucous glands, consisting of water, mucin, protein, and enzymes. It moistens the mouth, lubricates ingested food, and begins the breakdown of starches.
Saliva is a watery substance located in the mouths of animals, secreted by the salivary glands.
I.e. either the result or act of drooling as opposed to normal salivation: see wikt: slaver
A secretion from the salivary glands (found in the mouth) that can be spat out.

bn:00028710n: Flowing in drops; the formation and falling of drops of liquid
A falling or letting fall in drops; act of dripping.

bn:00028709n: A small mass of liquid just large enough to hold its own weight via surface tension, usually one that falls from a source of liquid.
A drop or droplet is a small column of liquid, bounded completely or almost completely by free surfaces.
A small indefinite quantity (especially of a liquid)--Kipling
A very small quantity of a liquid that has taken the form of a sphere.
A single droplet of rainwater that has just fallen or is falling from the sky.

bn:00066032n: Precipitation in the form of liquid water drops with diameters greater than 0.5 millimetres.
Water falling in drops from vapor condensed in the atmosphere
Rain is liquid water in the form of droplets that have condensed from atmospheric water vapor and then precipitated -- that is, become heavy enough to fall under gravity.
Condensed water falling from a cloud.
The amount of rain that falls on a single occasion
Water which falls as rain from clouds.
Liquid water in the form of droplets that have condensed from atmospheric water vapor and then precipitated.
Rain is liquid precipitation, as opposed to non-liquid kinds of precipitation such as snow, hail and sleet.

bn:00042379n: Chemical compound formed of molecules composed of two atoms of hydrogen and one of oxygen

Binary compound that occurs at room temperature as a clear colorless odorless tasteless liquid; freezes into ice below 0 degrees centigrade and boils above 100 degrees centigrade; widely used as a solvent
The liquid form of this chemical; liquid H?O.
Common liquid (H?O) which forms rain, rivers, the sea, etc., and which makes up a large part of the bodies of organisms.
Water is a common chemical substance, that is essential to all known forms of life.
Water is a transparent fluid which forms the world's streams, lakes, oceans and rain, and is the major constituent of the fluids of living things.
